The Enchanted Forest: This habitat would be designed to resemble a mystical forest filled with towering trees, sparkling streams, and a diverse array of flora and fauna. Visitors would be able to explore the habitat through a network of elevated walkways and observation decks, allowing them to observe the animals in their natural habitats without disrupting them.

The Coral Reef Oasis: This habitat would be designed to mimic the vibrant colors and diversity of a coral reef ecosystem. Visitors would be able to observe a variety of marine animals, including fish, sea turtles, and even sharks, as they swim and play in the reef. The habitat would also feature interactive exhibits and educational displays, teaching visitors about the importance of coral reefs and how to protect them.

The Arctic Tundra: This habitat would be designed to resemble the vast, icy expanses of the Arctic tundra. Visitors would be able to observe polar bears, arctic foxes, and other arctic animals as they roam and hunt in their natural habitats. The habitat would also feature interactive exhibits and educational displays, teaching visitors about the unique adaptations of arctic animals and the challenges they face in their harsh environment.

The African Savannah: This habitat would be designed to resemble the vast, grassy plains of the African savannah. Visitors would be able to observe a variety of African animals, including lions, zebras, and giraffes, as they roam and hunt in their natural habitats. The habitat would also feature interactive exhibits and educational displays, teaching visitors about the complex social structures of African animals and the importance of preserving their habitats.

The Amazon Rainforest: This habitat would be designed to resemble the dense, humid environment of the Amazon rainforest. Visitors would be able to observe a variety of tropical animals, including monkeys, sloths, and toucans, as they swing and climb through the forest canopy. The habitat would also feature interactive exhibits and educational displays, teaching visitors about the importance of preserving the Amazon rainforest and the unique biodiversity it supports.
